sen.j: 妹尾 兼康（せのお かねやす、保安 (元号)4年（1123年） - 寿永2年10月12日 (旧暦)（1183年11月28日））は、平安時代末期の平氏方の武将。
sen.e: Kaneyasu SEONO (1123-November 28, 1183) was busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the last days of Heian period and who was on the side of the Taira clan.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）には奈良で蜂起した僧兵たちの鎮圧を任せられたが、本格的な武装を禁じられたため多くの死傷者を出した。
sen.e: In 1180, he was entrusted to suppress armed priests who rose in revolt in Nara, but since the men in his army were prohibited from fully equipping themselves, many were killed and wounded.

sen.e: Later, he returned to help his legitimate child Muneyasu SEONO who was too fat to move by himself; however, he was killed near Itakura Station in Bicchu Province (present-day Soia City, Okayama Prefecture).
